    • Method Detail

      • registerNotificationToken

        public void registerNotificationToken(Map<String,Object> params,
                             ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Register a token to send application dependent notifications like Google Cloud Messaging, or Apple Push Notifications.

        Target API Endpoint: /notification/token

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.token
          A token that is generated by the device to sign requests for the notification service providers
        • SirqulKeys.pushType
          The type of push notification. Possible values include: APNS, GCM
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key
        • SirqulKeys.active
          Sets whether the token is active or not (non-active tokens are not used)
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          android.location.Location used to update the user's current location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NotificationApiBase.registerNotificationToken

      • searchNotifications

        public void searchNotifications(Map<String,Object> params,
                       ISirqulCallback<NotificationMessageListResponse> callback)
        Get a list of notifications for a user. If the "markAsRead" parameter is set to true, the returned notifications will be marked as "read" after the response has been sent. By default, read messages will not be returned, so to see read messages, set "returnReadMessages" to true.

        Ex. get a list of chat messages:

        eventType = "CUSTOM"
        returnReadMessages = (for android) 1, (for ios) 0,
        fromDate = (required for android, not required for ios) date since the last chat retrieval

        Target API Endpoint: /notification/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key to filter messages by application
        • SirqulKeys.eventTypes
          the event types
        • SirqulKeys.contentIds
          comma separated list of content ids to search notifications on
        • SirqulKeys.contentTypes
          comma separated list of content types to search notifications on
        • SirqulKeys.parentIds
          comma separated list of parent ids to search notifications on
        • SirqulKeys.parentTypes
          comma separated list of parent types to search notifications on
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          search notifications via keyword
        • SirqulKeys.returnReadMessages
          if set to true, will return notifications that have been marked as read
        • SirqulKeys.markAsRead
          if set to true, the returned notifications will be marked as "read" after the response has been sent
        • SirqulKeys.fromDate
          filter notifications from this date
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location
        • SirqulKeys.start
          start of the pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          limit of the pagination

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        NotificationMessageListResponse on an valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NotificationApiBase.searchNotifications

      • searchRecipients

        public void searchRecipients(Map<String,Object> params,
                    ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<NotificationRecipientResponse>> callback)
        Search for application users to send notifications.

        Target API Endpoint: /notification/recipient/search

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          filters results by application. If this is empty, will return all recipients for all applications that the user has access to.
        • SirqulKeys.conduit
          the type of notification to send {EMAIL, SMS, MOBILE_NOTIFICATION}
        • SirqulKeys.keyword
          search by keyword on user's display name and email
        • SirqulKeys.sortField
          The field to sort by. Possible values include: {ACCOUNT_DISPLAY, CREATED, UPDATED, ACTIVE, DELETED, LAST_LOGGED_IN, CONTACT_EMAIL, RETAILER_LOCATION_NAME, RETAILER_NAME, APPLICATION_NAME}
        • SirqulKeys.descending
          Determines whether the sorted list is in descending or ascending order
        • SirqulKeys.start
          the start of the pagination
        • SirqulKeys.limit
          the limit of the pagination (hard limit of 1000)

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        SearchResponse<NotificationRecipientResponse> on an valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NotificationApiBase.searchRecipients

      • sendBatchNotifications

        public void sendBatchNotifications(Map<String,Object> params,
                          ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Send notifications to all users of an application. Only someone with permissions to the application can do this.

        Target API Endpoint: /notification/batch

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          The account id of the application owner/manager
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          The application key for updating an existing application
        • SirqulKeys.conduit
          The type of notification to send {EMAIL, SMS, MOBILE_NOTIFICATION}
        • SirqulKeys.customMessage
          Message string that will be displayed in on the notification
        • SirqulKeys.contentId
          Default notification pay-load field (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.contentName
          Default notification pay-load field (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.contentType
          Default notification pay-load field (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.parentId
          Default notification pay-load field (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.parentType
          Default notification pay-load field (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NotificationApiBase.sendBatchNotifications

      • sendNotification

        public void sendNotification(Map<String,Object> params,
                    ISirqulCallback<SirqulResponse> callback)
        Send your own custom notification to a user. NOTE: the EventType of these notifications will be "CUSTOM". Notifications sent to yourself will currently be ignored.

        Payload Ex. for Playfield chat messages: User John (1) sends the message "Hello!" to user Josh (2)
        receiverAccountIds = 2
        contentId = 1
        contentName = message from the user (i.e. "Hello!")
        contentType = "CHAT"
        customMessage = message in the notification (i.e. "John says: Hello!")

        Target API Endpoint: /notification/custom

        Available parameters for this api
        • SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
          the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        • SirqulKeys.receiverAccountIds
          comma separated list of account IDs that will receive the notification
        • SirqulKeys.includeFriendGroup
          determines whether to send to all of the user's friends, this flag must be true or receiverAccountIds must not be empty
        • SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
          the application key.
        • SirqulKeys.conduit
          the type of notification to send {EMAIL, SMS, MOBILE_NOTIFICATION}
        • SirqulKeys.contentId
          notification pay-load (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.contentName
          notification pay-load (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.contentType
          notification pay-load (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.parentId
          notification pay-load (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.parentType
          notification pay-load (usage is dependent on the app and the type of event)
        • SirqulKeys.customMessage
          message string that will be displayed in on the notification
        • SirqulKeys.friendOnlyAPNS
          only sends APNS to people who are friends of the user (still saves the notification message for feed polling)
        • SirqulKeys.location of type Location
          the location

        SirqulResponse subclass type:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Parameters:
        params - the Map<String, Object> containing the parameters, both required and any optional ones you wish to send through to this api.
        callback - an optional ISirqulCallback instance that handles your response from this Sirqul API call. With this, API responses are automatically checked for validity or invalidity, whether it was null entirely, and to throw a SirqulException for any and all Exception's that may have occurred. Each of these cases are broken up into separate interface methods. If you foresee yourself needing to handle all cases, it's recommended you simply instantiate a new ISirqulCallback instance, which will force you to implement all methods. If you really only care about one or a few of them, you can use the SirqulCallback class, which you can optionally override any of those same interface methods. If you wish to ignore any response, simply pass in null for this.
        See Also:
        NotificationApiBase.sendNotification
